column12: Hot embossing machine and method of using
column13: An apparatus for embossing panels used in building utilises low wattage blowers to heat a zone upstream of the embossing site. Embossing is carried out by feeding a panel through the nip of an embossing wheel and an anvil roller. A track is rolled into the hard panel surface and various decorative effects are achieved by using side by side arrangements of wheels. The tendency to panel splitting is reduced by the provision of hot localised zones. The apparatus is sufficiently wide to receive the panel in both axes.
column15: BATES ROBERT ERNEST

column12: Improvements in or relating to fire alarms
column13: 645,483. Fire alarms. STANDARD TELEPHONES & CABLES, Ltd. July 18, 1947, No. 19283. [Class 40 (i)] To test the code signalling mechanism of a fire-alarm box without transmitting signals over the closed loop system, a phone hand-set is plugged into the " Test " jack, whereby it is connected in parallel with a resistor R and the code-contact SC1 so that the code may be heard in the phone but the line is not interrupted. The door contact DS1 removes a short-circuit from the line and earth jacks when the door is opened, to permit phone communication with the central station. Specification 619,501 is referred to.

column12: Improvements in Marking or Scoring at Games of Billiards and the like
column13: 26,534. Bates, A. E., and Waud, W. Dec. 6. Scoring and marking.-A device for scoring billiards &c. consists of two discs A mounted behind a board having a slot E, through which numbers on the discs may be seen. The discs are rotated by handles F, and are held in the desired position by rollers C mounted upon spring levers L. One of the discs is fitted with a pawl B, which engages pins H on the other disc and causes it to rotate through one division for each revolution of the former disc.
column15: BATES ALFRED ERNEST;;WAUD WILLIAM

column13: A method for roughening the surface of a thermoplastic sheet material, e.g. polypropylene or copolymers of ethylene or propylene comprises treating the surface with a hot solution of a minor proportion of a contact type adhesive composition and removing excess solvent and contact adhesive. Specified solvents are white spirit, toluene, xylene and chlorinated hydrocarbons.

column13: 1,179,238. Semi-permeable membrane of cellulose acetate. COURTAULDS Ltd. 19 May, 1967 [20 May, 1966], No. 22524/66. Heading B5B. [Also in Divisions B1 and C3] A semi-permeable membrane for desalination of water is prepared by forming a solution of cellulose acetate in aqueous acetic acid containing 5-25% of water by weight, casting as a film of uniform thickness and removing the acetic acid by immersing in water to effect coagulation of the film. Other water-soluble pore-forming agents may also be added e.g. polyvinyl alcohol or agents soluble in the aqueous acetic acid solvent e.g. methyl and hydroxyethyl cellulose. The cellulose acetate preferably has an acetyl content of 52-56À5% by weight. It is advantageous to separate the coating and coagulation steps by at least 5 minutes. The membranes of the example were heat-shrunk by immersion in hot water to yield more efficient membranes for desalination.

column13: The Viewable Object Processor of the present invention utilizes object handles that allow users to perform operations on windows and other viewable objects (e.g., move or resize a window) without having to depress a key (or key sequence) on a keyboard or a button on a pointing device such as a mouse. Essentially, object handles are specialized regions created on a display screen. Associated with each object handle is a particular geometric shape and a object handle type. The shape of each object handle identifies the bounds of the particular object handle. To perform an operation on a viewable object, a user need only cause the cursor to enter into the object handle region of a handle that corresponds to the operation that the user wishes to perform.

column12: Improvements in or relating to presses
column13: 1,057,560. Presses; blanks transferring. CONEX SANBRA Ltd. Oct. 19, 1965 [Oct. 22, 1964], No. 43073/64. Headings B3H and B3W. A press of the kind including a reciprocable ram 10, a stationary die 12, and a reciprocable feed slide 38, includes a mechanical driving connection between the ram and slide which is interrupted in the vent of the slide becoming jammed. The driving connection includes a toggle mechanism on each side-of the slide, each mechanism comprising four arms 46, 48, 50, 52. Arms 46 and 48 are pivotally connected to the ram and slide respectively while arm 50 is pivoted by a pin 64 to the arm 52 which is attached at 66 to a press support 30. The arm 52 is biased downwardly by a spring so that the pin 64 normally remains at the bottom of a guide slot 36. A common pivot pin 66 connects the ends of arms 46, 48 and 50, these arms being adjustable in length. In operations, the slide 38 is moved to the position shown as the ram 10 is raised, thus feeding a blank from a shoot 20 to the die 12. Simultaneously, a previous blank is ejected from the die 12 and pushed by the end of the slide 38 to a discharge station. Should the slide jam. the pivot point 68 becomes stationary and upward movement of the ram causes the pin 64 to be pulled upwardly in the slot 36. A microswitch 68 is contacted by the arm 52 and drive to the ram is interrupted. The ram is driven by an electric motor, and the blanks reaching the shoot 20 are fed in step-by-step manner from a gas fired furnace 16.

column12: Improvements in or relating to Machines for Moulding the End Portions of Boots and Shoes.
column13: 3090. Gouldbourn, J., Bates, A., and Jerram, A. E. Feb. 25. Uppers, machines for.-A machine for moulding the end portions of uppers, of the type in which the upper is engaged between inner and outer moulds while wiping-means force a projecting portion of the upper over a surface on one of the moulds to form a flange, is provided with means to allow a relative tilting movement between the wiping- means and the mould, so that the wiping-means automatically accommodate themselves to variations in the thickness of the flange. The invention is described as applied to a machine of the type described in Specification 1278/14, with the provision, if desired, of a back wiper as described in Specification 24,760/14. The wipers D<1>, D<2> are pivoted to a plate D<5>* located in a frame D<6> and recessed to receive a second plate D<5>, the under surface of which is curved in a transverse direction, as shown in Fig. 2. The plate D<5> is connected by a pair of toggles D<19>, D<20> to two plungers D<21>, each of which is pressed downwards by a pair of adjustable springs D<22> bearing on a cross-head D<21>* formed on or secured to the plunger. Springs D<19>*, D<20>* tend to maintain the plates D<5>, D<5>* in engagement when the toggles are broken. The wipers are first closed, and then the toggles are straightened to force down the wipers as described in the Specification 1278/14, during which operation the wipers accommodate themselves to the work by a longitudinal tipping movement of the plate D<5> or a transverse tipping movement of the plate D<5>*. Specification 10,360/14 also is referred to.

column12: SISTEMA Y PROCEDIMIENTO DE CONTROL DEL ARRANQUE DE LA RODADURA PARA TRANSMISIONES MECANICAS SEMIAUTOMATICAS.
column13: Procedimiento para controlar un sistema de transmisión mecánica de cambio de engranajes semiautomática (10) comprendiendo un motor controlado por acelerador y combustible (14) provisto de una velocidad libre conocida (ESIDLE), una transmisión mecánica de cambio de engranajes de múltiples velocidades (12), un embrague maestro de fricción (16) interpuesto entre el motor y la transmisión, una palanca de selección del cambio accionada manualmente (1) desplazable en una primera dirección desde una posición centrada para seleccionar cambios hacia arriba y en una segunda dirección desde dicha posición centrada para seleccionar cambios hacia abajo desde la relación de transmisión actualmente acoplada, una unidad central de proceso (38) para recibir entradas indicativas de la relación de transmisión acoplada de la velocidad del motor (ES), de la velocidad del árbol de salida de la transmisión (OS) y del funcionamiento de dicha palanca manual de selección del cambio y para procesar las mismas de acuerdo con reglas lógicas predeterminadas para emitir señales de salida de mandato a los accionamientos no controlados manualmente incluyendo un accionamiento del embrague (30), un accionamiento del control del acelerador y combustible (26) y un accionamiento de la transmisión (34), dicho procedimiento caracterizado porque si dicha transmisión está en neutro (GR=N) y dicha velocidad del vehículo excede de un valor de referencia mínimo (OS>REF), automáticamente selecciona el funcionamiento en un modo de funcionamiento de arranque de la rodadura, en el que un único movimiento de dicha palanca de selección del cambio en la dirección de cambio hacia arriba es interpretado como una selección del operario de un cambio directo desde neutro a una relación de transmisión adecuada de arranque de la rodadura (GRRS), dicha relación de transmisión apropiada de arranque de la rodadura determinada como una función de la velocidad actual del vehículo y del gradiente de la misma.

A portion of the window is optionally kept on the screen so that the window is not tossed completely off of the screen.

column12: Improvements in or relating to closed circuit electric signalling systems
column13: 646,655. Fire-alarm systems. STANDARD TELEPHONES & CABLES, Ltd. Oct. 13, 1947, No. 27407. [Class 40 (i)] In a signalling system employing a number of normally ungrounded, series-fed, closed loops, each including a number of transmitters such as Box A, B, and normally energized line relays LA, LB, Fig. 1, the loops are changed over to parallel grounded connection by a relay K during a signalling operation whereby signals from two transmitters on the same or different loops may be recorded simultaneously at a central station as described hereafter. Normal operation, one loop.-On operation of box A, the first breakimpulse makes a circuit at the central station over mc3 down, lar1 up, loop relay contacts la2 down energizing change-over-relay K and relay KA in parallel to stick up over ka1, Fig. 2. Loop relay LB energizes relay KB similarly. (Slow-release fault-detecting relays LAR, LBR normally maintained energized by loop relays LA, LB, do not drop out during breakimpulses.) Change-over-relay K connects the two ends of the loop in parallel and grounds the battery, Fig. 1, whereafter Box A sends the rest of the signal over the ground circuit (switch ES being closed during operation). Each further impulse from the transmitter drops la1, lb1 to make a circuit over ka2, kb2 up for the punching relays PA, PB, which operate momentarily only and are de-energized by RA, RB. With a single loop the energizing circuit for PB may be assumed to run over the chain-dotted line from PB to kb2. Two boxes-one loop.-If Boxes A and B operate simultaneously they will control relays LA, LB respectively in the two parallel arms formed when the loop is changed over and the battery grounded by relay K and hence the punching relays PA, PB will record signals from boxes A and B respectively. Boxes in different loops, e.g. loops 1 and 2.- Relays 21a, 2lb in the second loop circuit (not shown) will operate relays 2ka, 2kb (not shown), as described above for a single loop. Punching- relay PB will be controlled by 2lb1 over 2kb2 up, 3ka3, 3kb2 down, while punching-relay PA follows la1 in the first loop as before. Open circuit fault.-A prolonged break due to loop-open-circuit, releases LAR to energize relay KR which is held up by its second winding and energizes the second winding of relay K to change the loop to parallel grounded connection, whereby signals may be sent as above when a box operates. The fault circuit is released by key RK de-energizing the second winding of relays KR and K. Recording and resetting.-The punching-relays PA, PB energize the paper-feed-motor-relay MS to stick up and start the motor, Fig. 3, which closes cam-operated contacts RC, once a revolution, to energize relay MP. When the punching signals cease, the relay chain MA ... ME is energized in steps over ms3, pa3, pb3 for every closure of mp1, and de-energizes relays KA, KB over mc3 up and finally breaks the motor relay circuit over me3, by which time the perforated paper signal has been fed clear of the punches.

column12: Scrolling gear ratio selection control system and method
column13: A control system and method for a semi-automatic mechanical transmission system (10) is provided for allowing operator request for a scrolling display of allowable ratios in either the upshift or downshift direction, and for a direct shift into the selected one of the displayed ratios. In one embodiment, retaining the control (1) lever in a displaced position for one or two seconds will initiate the scrolling display, while retaining the transmission engaged in the initial ratio, and subsequently release of the control lever to its centered position will cause a direct shift into the then displayed ratio. <IMAGE> <IMAGE>
column15: BATES IAN RICHARD JOSEPH;;STAINTON JOHN ERNEST;;WHEELER ROBERT STANLEY

column13: A charcoal grill (100) includes a mechanism whereby a user may adjust the vertical distance between a fuel grate and a cooking grid by rotating a control knob (155) located on the surface of the charcoal grill. This mechanism provides a safer and more convenient way of adjusting the distance between the burning fuel and the food being cooked. The charcoal grill further includes a removable ash collector (135) located at the bottom of the charcoal grill. To empty ash a user slides the ash collector out form its position at the bottom of the charcoal grill, empties it, and then replaces it to resume ash collection. Thus a user may conveniently dispose of ash without the use of an ash sweep tool and without interruption operation. Furthermore the charcoal grill includes a metal skirt (300) inside its lower shell (140), which protects the lower shell of the charcoal grill from excessive heat, lengthening its operational life.
column15: CHAVANA ERNEST MATTHEW JR;;GIEBEL MICHAEL;;JAFFE DANENE N;;BATES MARK CHRISTOPHER

column13: Appareil de contrôle de balancement pour une utilisation clinique possédant deux ou plusieurs émetteurs d'ultrasons (1A, 1B) et des récepteurs associés. Des impulsions rapides d'ultrasons sont dirigées sur un sujet (2) dont on détermine les mouvements de balancement se rapprochant ou s'éloignant de chaque émetteur en mesurant le temps nécessaire à la détection du faisceau réfléchi. Les données peuvent être analysées et stockées en continu à l'aide d'un système d'ordinateur (17) et/ou d'un équipement d'enregistrement.

column13: A sway monitor for clinical use having two or more ultrasound transmitters (1A, 1B) and associated receivers. Rapid pulses of ultrasound are directed towards a subject (2) whose swaying movements towards or away from each transmitter are assessed by measuring the time taken for the reflected beam to be detected. The data may be continuously analysed and stored by means of a computer system (17) and/or recording equipment.

column13: A hot forged article of a preselected profile is produced by heating a forging blank to elevated temperature and forging the blank at the elevated temperature between closed dies, to produce a forging of about the preselected profile of the final forging, but having flashing thereon. The flashing is removed by cooling the forging having flashing thereon to ambient temperature, and trimming the flashing from the forging by passing a trimming laser beam of sufficient power density to cut through the flashing along the preselected final profile of the forging. The forging may be post treated by passing a post treating excimer laser along the portion of the forging immediately adjacent the preselected profile, after the trimming laser has passed. The post treatment removes the heat affected zone, depending upon the energy level of the excimer laser.
